name: ENVS 80F
title: Introduction to Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems
description: Our current food system is unsustainable for the environment and unjust for the farmers, farmworkers, and consumers who depend on it. Course provides an interdisciplinary, experiential, and systems-focused introduction to agroecology and other approaches to advancing a more just and ecologically sustainable food system. Students will come to understand agroecology as a science for understanding agricultural ecosystems, as a farming practice, and as a social movement to change the way we produce and distribute/access food. Course examines many topics?including biological fertility and pest management, seeds, livestock raising, and aquaculture?from the perspective of both the natural and social sciences, leaving students with a perspective that transcends any particular academic discipline. Students gain hands-on experience with farming research, production, and food distribution happening across the UCSC campus farm and food system.
class_notes: You are required to attend 1 section per week. Sections occur on campus, across the Center for Agroecology facilities, Farm, Gardens, Pop-Up Pantries, Kitchens. Students are assigned locations the week classes begin.
